PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_ProtectiveDeviceTypeCommon
PropertySetDef.Definition: Definition from IAI: Common properties for different protective device types.

PropertyDef.Name: RatedShortCircuitCurrent
PropertyDef.Definition: An overcurrent resulting from a fault of negligible impedance between live conductors having a difference in potential under normal operating conditions. (IEC 826-05-08)

PropertyDef.Name: CutOffCurrent
PropertyDef.Definition: The maximum instantaneous value of current attained during the breaking operation of a protective device. (IEC 441-17-12)

PropertyDef.Name: LimitingTerminalSize
PropertyDef.Definition: The maximum terminal size capacity of the device.

PropertyDef.Name: SwitchingDuty
PropertyDef.Definition: The maximum number of operations for the device at the rated making and breaking capacity.

PropertyDef.Name: CharacteristicTripCurve
PropertyDef.Definition: A curve giving the time, e.g. prearcing time or operating time, as a function of the protective current under stated conditions of operation.

PropertyDef.Name: ProtectiveTagType
PropertyDef.Definition: The breaking capacity value of the device. Note: This may be expressed as a code or a value depending on standard and/or source.

PropertyDef.Name: StandardUsed
PropertyDef.Definition: The electrical standard used as a reference when preparing data for the device.
